app.containers.HomePage.title: NCP-VIS
app.containers.HomePage.desc: Novel Coronavirus Pneumonia(NCP) is a severe acute respiratory syndrome that broke out in Wuhan, China in 2019. The infectious disease was caused by a new coronavirus and quickly spread to hundreds of cities in China and several countries within a short period of time. As of February 21, 2019, more than 70,000 people have been diagnosed. Our system (NCP-VIS) visually shows the trend of disease Spread in various cities. NCP-VIS uses geographic layout and radial layout to explore the trend of disease and correlation between cities.
